intro: Neocussonia bracteolifera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved neocussonia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Neocussonia bracteolifera is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
